meanings.definition: To lie in warmth or sunlight, especially for pleasure
meanings.sent1: The cat basked in the sun on the windowsill.
meanings.sent2: After swimming, the otters basked on the rocks to dry off.
meanings.sent3: The lazy dog basked in the sun all day, feeling like a king.
meanings.sent4: The flowers basked in the gentle sunlight, soaking up its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The lizard basked on the hot rock, enjoying the heat on its scales.

meanings.definition: To take great pleasure or satisfaction in something
meanings.sent1: She basked in the praise she received for her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The children basked in the joy of playing together in the park.
meanings.sent3: He basked in the glory of his victory, feeling proud and accomplished.
meanings.sent4: The author basked in the success of her bestselling novel, relishing every moment.
meanings.sent5: The team basked in the excitement of winning the championship, celebrating their hard work.
